dict.acceptation: “can”的过去式；能够，打算；用于假设语气的条件句；用于虚拟语气的结论句；

sent.orig: Historically there was no letter "l" in the word "could"; it was inserted by analogy with "would".
sent.trans: 在历史上，could一词中没有字母l；那是按照would一词类推而加上去的

sent.orig: Neither could theory do without practice, nor could practice do without theory.
sent.trans: 理论没有实践不行，实践没有理论也不行。

sent.orig: No one could emerge from that avalanche alive, unless one believed that man could rise from the dead.
sent.trans: 没人能从那次雪崩中活着出来，除非相信人能死而复生。

sent.orig: She could hate as passionately as she could love.
sent.trans: 她能恨得咬牙切齿，也能爱得一往情深。

sent.orig: The two-way choice system as a reform of the present job assignment system for college graduates means that graduates could choose employers and employers could choose graduates, both of their own free will.
sent.trans: 作为对大学毕业生分配制度的改革，双向选择制度意味着，毕业生可以选择用人单位，用人单位也可以选择毕业生，双方均出于自愿。
